LanguageData.VT_Settings_TipNote: Note: Hover over a setting name to see a tooltip with details.
LanguageData.VT_ShockwaveSpeed_Tooltip: How many cells the shockwave expands in one second.
LanguageData.VT_FireStartChance_Tooltip: Chance to start a fire in an affected cell.
LanguageData.VT_ExplosionChance_Tooltip: Chance to spawn a small explosion in an affected cell.
LanguageData.VT_FireSize_Tooltip: Size of fires created by the shockwave.
LanguageData.VT_VisualsFleckChance_Tooltip: Chance to display a flash on each processed cell.
LanguageData.VT_TickFrequency_Tooltip: Higher values update less often. For example, value of 10 means a single update happens once every 10 frames, while 1 means updates are calculated for each frame.
LanguageData.VT_BaseCellChance_Tooltip: Controls probability of running calculation for a particular cell. Because of how explosion ring rasterization works, too high values lead to some cells affected twice (which slows down animation without any additional value), too low values could lead to gaps in shockwave processing, leaving some cells intact. Overall, higher values look fuller but cost more performance.
LanguageData.VT_VisualsOnly_Tooltip: Skip all destruction and show only visual effects. Recommended for slow computers.
LanguageData.VT_RemoveGrass_Tooltip: Removes plants and grass in affected cells. Can significantly slow down in lush biomes.
LanguageData.VT_DestroyBuildings_Tooltip: Destroy furniture, fences, workbenches and everything else that can not support roof. Destroying this kind of things do not affect performance significantly.
LanguageData.VT_DestroyRoofholders_Tooltip: Also destroy roof-holding objects like walls or pillars. This usually triggers roof collapse calculations and slows the animation.
LanguageData.VT_AffectTerrain_Tooltip: Removes floors or bridges, destroys orbital platforms.
